page.description: The BITMAP_SIZE() function returns a dot variable containing the dimensions of an image file. It returns the height and width of a bitmap (as .height and .width properties) . Units are 'inches', 'pixels' or 'cm'.
page.syntax: Dimensions as P = bitmap_size(C filename [,C units ])
page.arguments:
A dot variable containing .height and .width properties.
Dimensions A dot variable containing .height and .width properties.
filename The name of the Windows Bitmap (.BMP) or JPEG image file to examine.
units The unit of measurement. The options are:
"inches"
"cm"
"pixels"
page.example: dim ptr as P ptr = bitmap_size("C:\test2.jpg", "pixels") ? ptr.height = 1024 ? ptr.width = 768
